active_contexts.statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 signals deeper contraction vs prelim.
active_contexts.market_link: Weaker EU manufacturing tone can weigh global risk sentiment and support duration; EUR-sensitive risk can react via 6E/DX.
active_contexts.notes: Germany export orders cited as a key drag.

active_contexts.statement: NY Fed standing repo operation take-up hit record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs.
active_contexts.market_link: Year-end funding tightness can spill into bills/GC repo and front-end rates; mainly a technical unless it persists post-turn.
active_contexts.notes: Monitor for normalization in early-Jan operations.

active_contexts.statement: ECB: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); M1 y/y 5.0% (Oct 5.2%).
active_contexts.market_link: Euro-area liquidity/backdrop can influence EUR rates and EUR-risk correlations; typically second-order vs growth/inflation shocks.

active_contexts.statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; unchanged vs forecast and prior release.
active_contexts.market_link: Limited surprise vs consensus; subcomponents (orders/prices) matter more for rates and equity cyclicality than headline level.

watchlist.statement: US cash close: MOC buy imbalance reported (S&P +1485.3M; NQ +330.8M; Dow +432.2M; Mag7 +273.3M).
watchlist.market_link: Large closing imbalances can drive late-session futures dislocations and increase next-session gap sensitivity in ES/NQ.
watchlist.notes: Fast-decaying; most relevant into next session.

watchlist.statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 (flash 51.2); still marginal expansion but less momentum than first read.
watchlist.market_link: UK/Europe data can influence broader risk tone and EUR/GBP complex; usually modest direct impact on US index futures.

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: Any reaction-function or policy-path framing can move front-end rate pricing and spill into equity duration sensitivity (ES/NQ).

upcoming_catalysts.name: FOMC Member Paulson Speaks
upcoming_catalysts.why_it_matters: A second appearance can reinforce or clarify guidance; focus on inflation vs growth balance and conditions for policy shifts.

change_log.reason: Confirmed details/wording via Reuters on record $74.6B standing repo operation take-up at year-end (Dec 31, 2025).
Confirmed Eurozone monetary aggregates figures and date via ECB press release (published Jan 2, 2026).
Prior watchlist TTL (2026-01-03T02:00:00Z) had expired; replaced with refreshed row and extended near-term TTL.
